item.title: 垃圾债券是新的高等级债券
item.description: 至少从信贷市场的价格来看，垃圾债务现在和投资级债务一样安全。【原文：Junk debt is about as safe as investment-grade now, at least according to prices in credit markets.】

item.title: 德国裁决考验伦敦作为首选重组中心的地位
item.description:
法兰克福法院撤销伦敦批准的重组协议 

【原文：

Frankfurt court set aside restructuring deal approved in London 

】

item.title: 西班牙裔消费者因担心通货膨胀和移民问题而减少消费
item.description: 增长最快的美国消费者群体之一正在踩刹车。【原文：One of the fastest-growing groups of US consumers is hitting the brakes.】

item.title: 爱迪生首席执行官表示，如果母公司 EDF 作出有利于自己的决定，则准备重新上市
item.description: 如果法国母公司批准通过首次公开募股重新上市的计划，法国电力公司（Electricite de France SA）的意大利子公司爱迪生公司（Edison SpA）准备重返公开市场。【原文：Electricite de France SA’s Italian unit, Edison SpA, is ready to return to the public market if its French parent approves a plan to relist through an initial public offering.】

item.title: 寻求稳定，从美国到印度
item.description:
特朗普解雇联邦储备委员会理事丽莎-库克的努力本周在法庭上取得进展。【原文：

Trump's efforts to fire Federal Reserve Board Governor Lisa Cook went forward in the courts this week.

】

item.title: 印度看到特朗普关税风暴中的一线希望
item.description: 印度 1947 年独立后采用的社会主义经济模式并不理想。1956 年，印度的人均收入与战后的韩国相差无几。韩国最终转型成为经济大国，而印度却持续落后。到 1991 年冷战结束时，印度经济已陷入全面危机，这一痛苦经历迫使新德里进行了一系列重大改革。【原文：The socialist economic model India adopted following its 1947 independence didn’t work out so well. In 1956, its per capita income was similar to that of post-war South Korea. While the latter eventually transformed itself into an economic giant, India continued to lag. By the end of the Cold War in 1991, its economy was spiraling into outright crisis, a wrenching experience that forced New Delhi into a raft of major reforms.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织警告安哥拉石油收入减少债务风险上升
item.description: 国际货币基金组织称，随着石油收入下降和外部借贷成本上升，安哥拉面临越来越大的债务风险。【原文：Angola faces mounting debt risks as oil revenue drops and external borrowing costs increase, the International Monetary Fund said.】

item.title: 据说 Adnoc 正在为桑托斯交易酝酿 100 亿美元以上的融资
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，阿布扎比国家石油公司正在考虑从本地和国际银行筹集超过 100 亿美元的债务融资，以推进其耗资约 190 亿美元收购澳大利亚化石燃料生产商桑托斯有限公司（Santos Ltd.）的计划。【原文：Abu Dhabi National Oil Co. is considering lining up more than $10 billion in debt financing from local and international banks as it moves forward with its roughly $19 billion pursuit of Australian fossil fuel producer Santos Ltd., according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 全球经济图表：美国就业数据疲软促使美联储降息
item.description: 令人失望的就业数据验证了人们对美国劳动力市场可能处于下滑边缘的担忧，并提升了人们对美联储今年降息幅度的预期。【原文：Disappointing employment data validated fears that the US labor market may be on the brink of a downturn and lifted expectations for how much the Federal Reserve will lower interest rates this year.】

item.title: 韩国最高外交官在突袭移民并抓获数百人后可能前往美国
item.description: 韩国最高外交官表示，如有需要，他将前往华盛顿处理美国突袭现代汽车公司制造厂的移民事件，并确认在此次行动中被拘留的475人中有300多人是韩国公民。【原文：South Korea’s top diplomat said he will travel to Washington if needed over a US migrant raid at a Hyundai Motor Co. manufacturing complex, confirming that more than 300 among 475 people detained under the operation are its citizens.】

item.title: 土耳其对游艇征收 8%的税，终止奢侈品免税政策
item.description: 土耳其对游艇、摩托艇和其他游艇征收 8%的特别消费税，结束了适用于豪华船只的零税率豁免。【原文：Turkey has slapped an 8% special consumption tax on yachts, motorboats and other pleasure craft, ending a zero-rate exemption that had applied to luxury vessels.】

item.title: 原油供应紧缺，石油交易商聚焦中国原油采购
item.description: 随着石油市场越来越接近长期预期的供应过剩，交易商们正在密切关注中国的买盘，看它是否会吸收世界原油生产国即将泵出的过剩原油。【原文：As the oil market moves closer to a long-anticipated glut, traders are closely watching buying from China to see if it will absorb an excess that the world’s crude producing nations are set to pump.】

item.title: 这就是黄金的时代
item.description: 这就是你的黄金的用途。【原文：This is what your gold is for.】

item.title: 又一批经美国批准的俄罗斯液化天然气运抵中国
item.description: 周六，第二艘从美国批准的俄罗斯出口工厂运载液化天然气的油轮抵达中国，北京继续扩大与莫斯科的关系，与华盛顿分庭抗礼。【原文：A second tanker carrying liquefied natural gas from a US-sanctioned Russian export plant arrived in China on Saturday, as Beijing continues to expand its relationship with Moscow in defiance of Washington.】

item.title: 泰国中央银行行长被推举为财政部长：报道
item.description: 据多家泰国媒体报道，泰国央行行长塞萨布-素提瓦特那鲁普（Sethaput Suthiwartnarueput）是新任总理阿努丁-占维拉库（Anutin Charnvirakul）领导的内阁中财政部长一职的主要候选人之一。【原文：Thailand’s central bank governor Sethaput Suthiwartnarueput is among the leading candidates for the role of finance minister in a cabinet under new Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul, according to multiple Thai media outlets.】

item.title: 央视称中国调查证券监管机构前主席易纲
item.description: 据国家广播公司 CCTV 报道，在易会满被意外免职一年多后，中国正在对其前最高证券监管机构进行调查。【原文：China is investigating Yi Huiman, its former top securities regulator, according to state broadcaster CCTV, more than a year after his surprise removal from the post.】

item.title: OpenAI 称到 2029 年支出将增至 1150 亿美元：信息
item.description: 据《The Information》报道，OpenAI 公司告诉投资者，预计到 2029 年，该公司的支出可能会增加到 1150 亿美元，比之前的预期高出约 800 亿美元，但该公司没有提供有关如何以及何时通知股东的详细信息。【原文：OpenAI Inc. told investors it projects its spending through 2029 may rise to $115 billion, about $80 billion more than previously expected, The Information reported, without providing details on how and when shareholders were informed.】

item.title: 巴菲特的俄勒冈州公用事业公司称火灾诉讼带来停业风险
item.description: 伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway Inc.【原文：Berkshire Hathaway Inc.’s PacifiCorp says ongoing litigation from massive wildfires in 2020 that exposed the company to billions of dollars in damages is jeopardizing its ability to continue providing power to hundreds of thousands of customers in Oregon.】

item.title: Momtazee's Patient Square 探索将 Premier 私有化
item.description: 据知情人士透露，由前 KKR & Co.交易员 Jim Momtazee 创办的投资公司 Patient Square Capital 正在探索收购医疗保健服务公司 Premier Inc.【原文：Patient Square Capital, the investment firm started by former KKR & Co. dealmaker Jim Momtazee, is exploring an acquisition of health-care services company Premier Inc., according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚年通胀率加快至 5.1%，创四个月新高
item.description: 8 月份，哥伦比亚的消费价格以四个月来最快的速度上涨，使总统古斯塔沃-彼得罗（Gustavo Petro）要求更大幅度降息的竞选活动受挫。【原文：Colombian consumer prices rose at their fastest pace in four months in August, dealing a setback to President Gustavo Petro’s campaign for deeper interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 惠誉下调波兰信用展望并警告财政风险
item.description: 惠誉国际评级公司（Fitch Ratings）表示，由于公共债务迅速增长，而政府削减巨额预算赤字的前景有限，该公司可能会降低波兰的 A-信用评级。【原文：Fitch Ratings signaled it may lower Poland’s A- credit score as public debt quickly grows and there’s limited prospects for the government to reduce its bulging budget deficit.】

item.title: 特朗普称哈希特、沃什和沃勒是美联储主席的最终人选
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示，他认为白宫经济顾问凯文-哈塞特（Kevin Hassett）、美联储理事克里斯托弗-沃勒（Christopher Waller）和前美联储理事凯文-沃什（Kevin Warsh）是最终人选，因为他正在选择央行主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）的继任者。【原文：President Donald Trump said that he saw White House economic adviser Kevin Hassett, Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller and former Fed Governor Kevin Warsh as the finalists, as he chooses a replacement for the central bank’s chair, Jerome Powell.】

item.title: Robinhood、AppLovin、Emcor 加入 S&P 500 指数再平衡行列
item.description: Robinhood Markets Inc.已被纳入S&P 500指数，标志着零售交易平台进入了一个新阶段，该平台曾帮助定义了大流行病时期的个人投资热潮。S&P Dow Jones Indices 周五表示，该公司将在最新的季度调整中加入该基准。【原文：Robinhood Markets Inc. has been added to the S&P 500, marking a new phase for the retail trading platform that helped define the pandemic-era boom in individual investing. The company will join the benchmark in the latest quarterly rebalance, S&P Dow Jones Indices said Friday.】

item.title: Meta 的支持是价值 260 亿美元的人工智能数据中心交易的关键所在
item.description: 当 Meta Platforms 公司向贷款人寻求 260 亿美元的债务融资，以建造一个庞大的新数据中心时，一个关键细节促成了这场激烈的竞标战：这家科技巨头同意为路易斯安那州的综合大楼提供特别担保。【原文：When Meta Platforms Inc. turned to lenders to secure $26 billion in debt funding for construction of a sprawling new data center, one key detail made all the difference in fueling a heated bidding war for the deal: the technology giant agreed to a special guarantee on the Louisiana complex.】

item.title: 加拿大就向 Mobilicity 支持者支付数亿美元的命令提出上诉
item.description: 加拿大政府正在对一项裁决提起上诉，该裁决称加拿大政府在推翻了无线领域的一项关键政策后，拖欠手机初创公司 Mobilicity 原始投资者数亿美元的赔偿金。【原文：The Canadian government is appealing a ruling that it owes the original investors in cellphone startup Mobilicity hundreds of millions of dollars in damages after reversing a key policy in the wireless sector.】

item.title: 对冲基金因供应紧张信号跃跃欲试看涨石油
item.description: 在有迹象表明欧佩克+将考虑在本周再次大幅提高原油产量之前，对冲基金对原油的看涨押注达到了6月以来的最高水平。【原文：Hedge funds boosted bullish bets on crude the most since June amid tightness in US markets and geopolitical risks, just before signs that OPEC+ will consider another major output boost sank futures this week.】

item.title: 华尔街的财富引擎在就业市场焦虑中迸发动力
item.description: 对于已经对人工智能时代的工作保障感到焦虑的美国工人来说，周五的经济数据无疑是一记重拳：这是迄今为止最明显的招聘停滞迹象。【原文：To American workers already anxious about their job security in the age of AI, Friday’s economic data was a gut punch: the clearest sign yet that hiring is stalling.】

item.title: 谷歌反垄断裁决对 OpenAI 和 Perplexity 来说喜忧参半
item.description: 法官不拆分谷歌业务的决定可能会使人工智能初创公司在搜索领域的竞争变得更加复杂。但首先...【原文：A judge’s decision not to break up Google’s business may complicate a push by AI startups to compete in search. But first…】

item.title: 税务人员喜欢 Z 世代追逐的 90% 的收益率
item.description:
这里有更多关于我们所处的 "创新杠铃 "的信息

。【原文：

Here’s more about the “innovation barbell” we’re in

】

item.title: Switch 2 打破销售记录，巩固任天堂全球领先地位
item.description:
对乐趣的传统关注和对技术潮流的抵制造就了一家与众不同的视频游戏制造商。【原文：

Un enfoque tradicional centrado en la diversión y la resistencia a las tendencias tecnológicas han dado lugar a un creador de videojuegos diferente a cualquier otro.

】
